def_cn: （数字）1
def_en: One is the number 1.

def_cn: 唯一的；仅有的
def_en: If you say that someone or something is the one person or thing of a particular kind, you are emphasizing that they are the only person or thing of that kind.

def_cn: （用于代替a以强调之后的名词）
def_en: One can be used instead of 'a' to emphasize the following noun.

def_cn: （用于代替a以强调之后的形容词或短语）
def_en: You can use one instead of 'a' to emphasize the following adjective or expression.

def_cn: （用于人名前，表示未曾相识或听闻的）某一个
def_en: You can use one in front of someone's name to indicate that you have not met them or heard of them before.

def_cn: （表示与其他的作比较）这一个
def_en: You can use one to refer to the first of two or more things that you are comparing.

def_cn: （用于代替名词，指代某类明确的人或事物）
def_en: You can use one or ones instead of a noun when it is clear what type of thing or person you are referring to and you are describing them or giving more information about them.

def_cn: （泛指）人们
def_en: You use ones to refer to people in general.

def_cn: （用于代替名词词组，表示刚提到过的事物）
def_en: You can use one instead of a noun group when you have just mentioned something and you want to describe it or give more information about it.

def_cn: （特指一群人或事物中的）一人，一个
def_en: You can use one when you have been talking or writing about a group of people or things and you want to say something about a particular member of the group.

def_cn: （同类事物或人中）（最…之）一
def_en: You use one in expressions such as 'one of the biggest airports' or 'one of the most experienced players' to indicate that something or someone is bigger or more experienced than most other things or people of the same kind.

def_cn: （过去或将来的）某一（时刻）
def_en: You can use one when referring to a time in the past or in the future. For example, if you say that you did something one day, you mean that you did it on a day in the past.  one day→see: day;

def_cn: （指代问题、笑话、评论、讨论的主题等）一个
def_en: You can use one to refer to a question, joke, remark, or subject of discussion.

def_cn: (一杯)酒
def_en: You can use one to refer to an alcoholic drink.

def_cn: （泛指包括自己的人，可作句子的主语或宾语）一个人，任何人
def_en: You use one to make statements about people in general which also apply to themselves. One can be used as the subject or object of a sentence.

def_cn: 一起；一致地
def_en: If a group of people does something as one, all the people do the same thing at the same time or in the same way.

def_cn: 喜欢（或赞成、乐于）…的人
def_en: If you say that someone is one for or is a one for something, you mean that they like or approve of it or enjoy doing it.

def_cn: （强调某人与众不同的反应或行为方式）举个例说
def_en: You can use for one to emphasize that a particular person is definitely reacting or behaving in a particular way, even if other people are not.

def_cn: （表示强调）很多
def_en: You can use expressions such as a hundred and one ,a thousand and one, and a million and one to emphasize that you are talking about a large number of things or people.

def_cn: 集（若干部分或功能）为一体
def_en: You can use in one to indicate that something is a single unit, but is made up of several different parts or has several different functions.

def_cn: 三三两两地；零零落落地
def_en: You can use in ones and twos to indicate that people do things or something happens gradually and in small groups.

def_cn: 一个接一个地；接连地；陆续地
def_en: You use one after the other or one after another to say that actions or events happen with very little time between them.

def_cn: （用于节目中介绍演员、歌手或其他名人）绝无仅有的，独一无二的
def_en: The one and only can be used in front of the name of an actor, singer, or other famous person when they are being introduced on a show.

def_cn: 逐个地；依次地
def_en: You can use one by one to indicate that people do things or that things happen in sequence, not all at the same time.

def_cn: （一组事物或人之中的）或者这个或者那个，有一个
def_en: You use one or other to refer to one or more things or people in a group, when it does not matter which particular one or ones are thought of or chosen.

def_cn: 一两个；几个
def_en: One or two means a few.

def_cn: 不大可能（做…)的人
def_en: If you say that someone is not one to do something, you think that it is very unlikely that they would do it because it is not their normal behaviour.

def_cn: 略胜…一筹；占…的上风
def_en: If you try to get one up on someone, you try to gain an advantage over them.
one and all→see: all;  one another→see: another;  one thing after another→see: another;  to pull a fast one→see: fast;  of one mind→see: mind;  in one piece→see: piece;  put one over on→see: put;
